EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.

div.head: BRIEFE PRINciples of religion, for the exerciſe of youth: done by Christopher Watſon.

p.hi: How waſt thou created?
p.note: The firſte parte pronounceth our condemnations

sp.speaker: Anſwere.
sp.p: By the hand of God.

p.hi: VVhat is God?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: He is almightie, creator of all things, incomprehenſible, inuiſible, eternal, preſeruer and gouernour of heauen and earth. &c.

p.hi: Why did he create thee?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: To ſerue him.

p.hi: What ſeruice requireth hee of thee?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Obedience to his lawes.

p.hi: Which are they?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: God ſpake all theſe wordes:
1 Thou ſhalt haue none other Gods but me.Exod. 21.10. the 18.

2 Thou ſhalt not make to thy ſelf any grauen Image, nor the likeneſſe of any thing that is in heauē aboue,
or in the earth beneath, nor in the water vnder the earth: thou ſhalt not bow downe to them nor worſhip them.
3 Thou ſhalt not take the name of the Lorde thy God in vaine.
4 Remember that thou kéepe holie the Saboth day.
5 Honour thy father & mother.
6 Thou ſhalt doe no murther.
7 Thou ſhalt not commit adultery.
8 Thou ſhalt not ſteale.
9 Thou ſhalt not beare falſe witneſſe againſt thy neighbour.
10 Thou ſhalt not deſyre thy neighbours houſe: thou ſhalt not couet thy neighbours wife, nor his ſeruant, nor his Maide, nor his Oxe, nor his Aſſe, nor any thing that is thy neighbours.

p.hi: Art thou bounde to obſerue theſe precepts, in thought worde and deede?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Yea, for if I breake but one of them in thought, once onely in all my lyfe, I ſhall be guiltie of eternal death.

p.hi:
Is eternall death then the rewarde
of breaking theſe ſtatutes?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Yea.

p.hi: Doeſt thou keepe them?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: No, nor no man liuing.

p.hi: Then thou graunteſt thy ſelf, with all men worthye of Gods diſpleaſure and eternall damnation.

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Yea trulye, I feele Gods wrath, & ſee hell to be my proper inheritance, and the fruites of my deſerte.

p.hi: How ſhalt thou eſcape gods wrath and this damnation?
p.note: The ſecond declareth our deliuerie by Chriſt.

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Onely by Ieſus Chriſt.

p.hi: How ſhall he ſaue thee?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Becauſe he being God and man, hath ſuffered al the puniſhmēt due for my ſinnes, and fulfilled the law.

p.hi: Shall all men be ſaued by Chriſt?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: No, none but ſuch as beleeue effectually in him.

p.hi: Who beleeue thus in him?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: They onelie whiche aſſure themſelues that all his ſufferinges was for them, and ſo trauell mortification of the fleſh.

p.hi: Who aſſures thee of this beleefe?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: The holy ghoſt works it by hearing the word preached.

p.hi: Declare the effect of thy beleefe.

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: I Beléeue in God the Father almighty, maker of heauen & earth. And in Ieſus Chriſt his only ſonne our Lord. Which was conceaued by the holye Ghoſt, borne of the Virgin Mary. Suffered vnder Ponce Pilate, was crucified dead and buried. Hee diſcended into hell. The thirde day hee roſe againe from the dead. He aſcended into heauen, & ſitteth on the right hande of God the father almightye. From thence he ſhall come to iudge the quick and the dead. I beleeue in the holy ghoſt. The holy Catholyke Church. The Communion of ſaints. The forgiueneſſe of ſinnes. The reſurrection of the body, and the lyfe euerlaſting. Amen.

p.hi: Is thy faith perfect aſſoone as thou beleeueſt?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p:
No, but encreaſeth continually
by hearing the worde preached, with vſing ye Sacraments & praiers.

p.hi: How many Sacramentes be there?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Two, Baptiſme and the Lordes ſupper.

p.hi: What meaneſt yu by Baptiſme?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: It declareth the waſhing away of my ſinnes by Chriſtes bloud, and my new birth.

p.hi: Then without this ſacrament none can aſſure thēſelues of ſaluatiō.

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: I ſay not ſo, Gods grace is not tyed to outwarde ſignes: we beleeue his promiſe, & therefore doubt not, but the children of the faithfull are ſaued, which dye before they be baptiſed.

p.hi: What thinkeſt thou by the Lordes Supper?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: I beléeue, that as my body is nouriſhed wt ye bread there broken, & wine powred foorth, that euen ſo my ſoule is nouriſhed ſpirituallye by Chriſtes body broken, & bloud ſhed for the remiſſion of my ſinnes.

p.hi: Are all, named Chriſtians, fit to receaue this ſacrament?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: No, none but ſuch as are able to diſcerne the Lords body.

p.note: The thirde our duty to God for all his benefits.
p.hi: Thou ſaydeſt, prayer was a help to encreaſe faith.

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Yea, for it aſſures me that I ſhall haue all that I aſke in Chriſtes name, according to Gods word.

p.hi: What praieſt thou for?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: For ſuch things as ye Lorde hath taught me, Sayings.

OVr Father whiche art in heauen, halowed hee thy name, Thy kingdome come. Thy wyll be done in earth, as it is in heauen. Giue vs this day our dayly bread. And forgiue vs our treſpaſſes, as we forgiue thē that treſpaſſe againſt vs. And lead vs not into tēptation. But deliuer vs from euil. For thine is the kingdom, ye power, & the glory, for euer & euer. Amen.

p.hi: Doeſt rhou pray to god onely, and not to the ſaintes?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Yea, for prayer is due to god onely.

p.hi: Art yu not bound to God for this thy wonderful creatiō, preſeruation, & deliuery from eternal death?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: Yea, ſo I account my ſelfe.

p.hi: What duties craues he at thy hands for the ſame?

sp.speaker: An.
sp.p: To ſerue & honour him preciſely, according to his word: which I purpoſe to do, as he by his holy ſpirit ſhall enable mée, knowing yt he ſhineth to none but ye elect, which labor according to their meaſure in reforming themſelues, wt a certaine perſuaſion that Chriſt hath performed al their duties, & diſcharged their diſobedience, in which holy work, God giue me ſtrength (for Chriſtes ſake) to labour all the dayes of my lyfe.

p.hi: Euen ſo. And God encreaſe thy faith, to the full aſſurance of thy ſaluation in CHRISTE. God ſaue our Queene Elizabeth.

div.p: PRINTED AT LONDON, by Hugh Singleton, dwelling in Creede lane, neere vnto Ludgate. 1581.
